values.title: deb-build should include URDF and ROS's OGRE

content.raw:
The binary deb-build should include ros-fuerte-urdfdom and friends, as well as ros-fuerte-visualization-common (to get ROS's OGRE, which include CG support).

Be sure to update Build-Depends and Depends in debian/control.
content.html:
The binary deb-build should include ros-fuerte-urdfdom and friends, as well as ros-fuerte-visualization-common (to get ROS's OGRE, which include CG support).

Be sure to update Build-Depends and Depends in debian/control.

values.title: deb-build Depends and Build-Depends require audit

content.raw: There are certainly some things missing. A candidate rule to apply: for each foo-dev that appears in Build-Depends, foo should appear in Depends.
content.html: There are certainly some things missing. A candidate rule to apply: for each foo-dev that appears in Build-Depends, foo should appear in Depends.

values.title: deb-build source packages are unsigned

content.raw:
Source packages (*.dsc) are not signed. They should be. Will require creating PGP keys for use by deb-build user.

Not strictly needed until we expect somebody who checks such things (e.g., Ubuntu) to consume our source packages as input.
content.html:
Source packages (*.dsc) are not signed. They should be. Will require creating PGP keys for use by deb-build user.

Not strictly needed until we expect somebody who checks such things (e.g., Ubuntu) to consume our source packages as input.

values.title: deb-build should upload to the right place

content.raw:
To start with, deb-build should upload to gazebosim.org somewhere. Waiting on SSH key installation.

After that, deb-build should dput files into proper repositories.
content.html:
To start with, deb-build should upload to gazebosim.org somewhere. Waiting on SSH key installation.

After that, deb-build should dput files into proper repositories.

values.title: Jenkins test builds should tag timed-out tests as failures

content.raw: Timed-out tests currently just don't show up in the report. Should dig into that tool that Ken wrote to synthesize failed test reports.
content.html: Timed-out tests currently just don't show up in the report. Should dig into that tool that Ken wrote to synthesize failed test reports.

values.title: Add post-install instruction to source setup.sh

content.raw:
After installing gazebo.deb, there should be a message to console telling people to do the following in every shell before using Gazebo:

        . /usr/share/gazebo/setup.sh
content.html:
After installing gazebo.deb, there should be a message to console telling people to do the following in every shell before using Gazebo:

    . /usr/share/gazebo/setup.sh

values.title: Remove warnings produced during debuild and pbuilder runs

content.raw: There are a fair number of warnings during the deb build, especially during the `debuild` step.  Have a look at them and remove what can be removed.
content.html: There are a fair number of warnings during the deb build, especially during the debuild step. Have a look at them and remove what can be removed.

values.title: gazebo 1.2.0-0ubuntu3 has wrong setup.sh content

content.raw: The gazebo 1.2.0-0ubuntu3 deb has the old setting for GAZEBO_DATABASE_URI (http://gazebosim.org/gazebo_models instead of http://gazebosim.org/models).  I'm pretty sure that that change was on the `dev` branch prior to the release being built.  Need to double-check that workflow.
content.html: The gazebo 1.2.0-0ubuntu3 deb has the old setting for GAZEBO_DATABASE_URI (http://gazebosim.org/gazebo_models instead of http://gazebosim.org/models). I'm pretty sure that that change was on the dev branch prior to the release being built. Need to double-check that workflow.

values.title: Build i386 debs

content.raw: Should just be a matter of kicking off a build with the appropriate ARCH param.  Have to check that reprepro does the right thing when asked to include the same version with different arch.
content.html: Should just be a matter of kicking off a build with the appropriate ARCH param. Have to check that reprepro does the right thing when asked to include the same version with different arch.

values.title: Release process can pull unpredictable version

content.raw:
The debbuild jobs are pulling from a branch; there's no way to guarantee which version exactly will be pulled for a given debbuild.  That's not a big deal yet, but it will start to be annoying.

We need something like the old ROS release.py script that tags, branches, pushes, and kicks off Jenkins jobs.  Look into bloom to see if it will do that work for us.
content.html:
The debbuild jobs are pulling from a branch; there's no way to guarantee which version exactly will be pulled for a given debbuild. That's not a big deal yet, but it will start to be annoying.

We need something like the old ROS release.py script that tags, branches, pushes, and kicks off Jenkins jobs. Look into bloom to see if it will do that work for us.

values.title: Prepare 1.2.6 release of Gazebo

content.raw: Nominate patches to be included.  Prepare pull request with them.  Bug fixes only.
content.html: Nominate patches to be included. Prepare pull request with them. Bug fixes only.

values.title: Make it possible to launch Gazebo by clicking

content.raw: It should appear in the appropriate Ubuntu menu.
content.html: It should appear in the appropriate Ubuntu menu.

values.title: gazebo.desktop needs to match deployed version

content.raw:
Most notably, the exec line needs to reference the proper gazebo directory to source the setup.sh

In the 1.3 installed version, the gazebo.desktop has this line
Exec=bash -c '. /usr/share/gazebo-1.2/setup.sh && gazebo'

and it should be:
Exec=bash -c '. /usr/share/gazebo-1.3/setup.sh && gazebo'
content.html:
Most notably, the exec line needs to reference the proper gazebo directory to source the setup.sh

In the 1.3 installed version, the gazebo.desktop has this line Exec=bash -c '. /usr/share/gazebo-1.2/setup.sh && gazebo'

and it should be: Exec=bash -c '. /usr/share/gazebo-1.3/setup.sh && gazebo'

values.title: gazebo debs should include player support

content.raw:
http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/467/libgazebo_player-not-working/?answer=468#post-id-468

Just need to add the right packages to the build-depends and depends lines in the control file.
content.html:
http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/467/libgazebo_player-not-working/?answer=468#post-id-468

Just need to add the right packages to the build-depends and depends lines in the control file.

values.title: Support for generating -dbg gazebo packages

content.raw:
At this moment, there is no binary packages being generated for gazebo versions which means that any binary (.deb) installation lacks of debugging symbols.

These are quite usefull in a case of crash so it would be nice to integrate the generation as part of the realising process.
content.html:
At this moment, there is no binary packages being generated for gazebo versions which means that any binary (.deb) installation lacks of debugging symbols.

These are quite usefull in a case of crash so it would be nice to integrate the generation as part of the realising process.

values.title: Testing ubuntu apport support for debugging

content.raw:
Ubuntu has a tool to provide useful information about a crash, it is called apport: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Apport

Seems like it does not need any special configuration for our part, but this needs to be confirmed:
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Apport/DeveloperHowTo

And it can provide an easy way to ask for the stacktrace:
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingProgramCrash
content.html:
Ubuntu has a tool to provide useful information about a crash, it is called apport: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Apport

Seems like it does not need any special configuration for our part, but this needs to be confirmed: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Apport/DeveloperHowTo

And it can provide an easy way to ask for the stacktrace: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingProgramCrash

values.title: Add Simbody to Gazebo build

content.raw:
We'd like to build and install Simbody from:

https://simtk.org/svn/simbody/branches/Simbody3.0.1

in the Gazebo `devel` builds.  It should be installed in a default way (probably in /usr/local), where Gazebo can find it.

It's similar to the way that we're installing Bullet in those builds.
content.html:
We'd like to build and install Simbody from:

https://simtk.org/svn/simbody/branches/Simbody3.0.1

in the Gazebo devel builds. It should be installed in a default way (probably in /usr/local), where Gazebo can find it.

It's similar to the way that we're installing Bullet in those builds.

content.raw:
After changes in the package generation included yesterday, it would be nice to have a 1.4 gazebo prerelease so we can extensively check if they are working as expected.

//cc @nkoenig and @hsu
content.html:

values.title: Fix support for looking ros related depedencies

content.raw:
Currently, gazebo is not able to find ros related depedencies if the ```CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH``` is not pointing to ros cmake modules.

Need to be fixed:

* Jenkins scripts.
* gazebo-release/ubuntu/debian/rules: currently set ```PKG_CONFIG_PATH``` in the configure step, but will also need the cmake prefix.
* http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Install#Ubuntu_Linux_2 : installation instructions prescribe setting ```PKG_CONFIG_PATH``` on the cmake call; should use the same cmake prefix.
content.html:
Currently, gazebo is not able to find ros related depedencies if the CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH is not pointing to ros cmake modules.

Need to be fixed:

  • Jenkins scripts.
  • gazebo-release/ubuntu/debian/rules: currently set PKG_CONFIG_PATH in the configure step, but will also need the cmake prefix.
  • http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/Install#Ubuntu_Linux_2 : installation instructions prescribe setting PKG_CONFIG_PATH on the cmake call; should use the same cmake prefix.

values.title: Merge changes from prerelease to default

content.raw: Once we get a working Gazebo 1.4 prerelease .deb (specifically, with urdfdom support), merge changes from the prerelease branch back to default before making the actual 1.4 release.
content.html: Once we get a working Gazebo 1.4 prerelease .deb (specifically, with urdfdom support), merge changes from the prerelease branch back to default before making the actual 1.4 release.

values.title: List of non including supports when building 1.4 deb packages

content.raw:
The [jenkins log](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debbuild/27/consoleFull) shows the following summary:

 	CEGUI not found, opengl GUI will be disabled.
 	libswscale not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
 	libavformat not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
 	libavcodec not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
 	Player not found, gazebo plugin for player will not be built.
 	GNU Triangulation Surface library not found - Gazebo will not have CSG support.

Special attention to this last gts new 1.4 dependency.

@gerkey are any of these desired to be in 1.4 package generation and jenkins 1.4 building scripts?

CEGUI not found, opengl GUI will be disabled.
libswscale not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
libavformat not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
libavcodec not found. Audio-video capabilities will be disabled.
Player not found, gazebo plugin for player will not be built.
GNU Triangulation Surface library not found - Gazebo will not have CSG support.

Special attention to this last gts new 1.4 dependency.

values.title: missing dependency for stereo_image_proc

content.raw:
~~~
roslaunch  atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch
~~~
produced following error:
~~~
process[multisense_sl/camera/stereo_proc-10]: started with pid [31628]
[ERROR] [1359686754.007537838]: Skipping XML Document "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/octomap_mapping/octomap_server/plugins/nodelet_plugins.xml" which had no Root Element.  This likely means the XML is malformed or missing.
~~~
which indicates octomap_server is missing `nodelet_plugins.xml`?
content.html:
roslaunch  atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch

produced following error:

process[multisense_sl/camera/stereo_proc-10]: started with pid [31628]
[ERROR] [1359686754.007537838]: Skipping XML Document "/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks/octomap_mapping/octomap_server/plugins/nodelet_plugins.xml" which had no Root Element.  This likely means the XML is malformed or missing.

which indicates octomap_server is missing nodelet_plugins.xml?

values.title: New setup for Quantal/Groovy packages need at gazebosim.org/assets

content.raw:
We currently have all packages build on precise using the fuerte ROS distribution.For new Quantal packages we need to design and create a new mechanism for hosting them and make a difference between precise-fuerte and quantal-groovy. 

Please note that current package (precise-fuerte) location should be keep for supporting all kind of external and internal applications and documentation available. Also, the design should be flexible enough to be able to host several ROS distribution per ubuntu distributions (just in case of a future decision can bring this possibility).

One option could be create a per-distribution/per-ros-distribution directory in the /assets/distributions/ with a symlink from /assets/distributions/precise/fuerte to current /assets/distributions.

Other option could be changing our naming rule for the .tar.bz2 and include the distribution as part of the name (drcsim-1.4-precise-fuerte.tar.bz2).

Ideas?
content.html:
We currently have all packages build on precise using the fuerte ROS distribution.For new Quantal packages we need to design and create a new mechanism for hosting them and make a difference between precise-fuerte and quantal-groovy.

Please note that current package (precise-fuerte) location should be keep for supporting all kind of external and internal applications and documentation available. Also, the design should be flexible enough to be able to host several ROS distribution per ubuntu distributions (just in case of a future decision can bring this possibility).

One option could be create a per-distribution/per-ros-distribution directory in the /assets/distributions/ with a symlink from /assets/distributions/precise/fuerte to current /assets/distributions.

Other option could be changing our naming rule for the .tar.bz2 and include the distribution as part of the name (drcsim-1.4-precise-fuerte.tar.bz2).

Ideas?

Support for Quantal distribution is need in our official repository packages.osrfoundation.org. 

Some projects have written information about [how to add a distribution using reprepro](http://bccd.net/wiki/index.php/FAQ#How_to_add_a_new_distribution_to_reprepro.3F).
content.html:
Support for Quantal distribution is need in our official repository packages.osrfoundation.org.

Some projects have written information about how to add a distribution using reprepro.

values.title: [tracker] Multi distribution support for gazebo 1.5 prerelease

content.raw:
This ticket will be used as a tracker about what is needed to do in order to get a gazebo 1.5 multi distribution release for both precise and quantal.

**Prerelease** **[done]**

**Release**

* **[done]** Be sure to use the [multidistribution2 branch](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/commits/all/tip/branch%28%22multidistribution2%22%29) of release-tools repository in jenkins or get it merged in default.
* Merge prerelease branch into default and be sure of changing all names in control and rules which refers to -prerelease.
* **[done]** Change jenkins job to use multidistribution-debbuild.bash
* Remember to add quantal to UBUNTU_DISTROS in release.py script
content.html:
This ticket will be used as a tracker about what is needed to do in order to get a gazebo 1.5 multi distribution release for both precise and quantal.

Prerelease [done]

Release

  • [done] Be sure to use the multidistribution2 branch of release-tools repository in jenkins or get it merged in default.
  • Merge prerelease branch into default and be sure of changing all names in control and rules which refers to -prerelease.
  • [done] Change jenkins job to use multidistribution-debbuild.bash
  • Remember to add quantal to UBUNTU_DISTROS in release.py script

values.title: Make -prerelease conflict with normal package

content.raw:
It would be convenient for `gazebo-prerelease` to conflict with `gazebo`.  Right now, `dpkg` will eventually refuse to install both because they try to own files by the same name.  But it's not always obvious what's going on, and it can take a bit of unwinding via `apt-get` to get back to a working state.

I think that each `foo-prerelease` package should explicitly conflict with the `foo` package.

Filing a ticket here for Gazebo, but the same applies to the other repositories.
content.html:
It would be convenient for gazebo-prerelease to conflict with gazebo. Right now, dpkg will eventually refuse to install both because they try to own files by the same name. But it's not always obvious what's going on, and it can take a bit of unwinding via apt-get to get back to a working state.

I think that each foo-prerelease package should explicitly conflict with the foo package.

Filing a ticket here for Gazebo, but the same applies to the other repositories.

values.title: Gazebo 1.5 quantal running error

content.raw:
I got the following error after following the Gazebo setup instruction on quantal:

```
#!python

error while loading shared libraries: libboost_program_options.so.1.46.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```

gazebo 1.5.0-1~quantal 


The boost package is not available for 1.46 on my machine (but 1.49 or 1.50 are)

```
#!python

Package libboost-program-options1.46-dev is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source

```

values.title: dependency on libavformat53 and libswscale2 does not allow the "extra" version

content.raw:
I can't install gazebo, because it explicitly depends on libavformat53 and libswscale2 and does not allow the "extra" versions (libavformat-extra-53 and libswscale-extra-2) which I have installed.

For libavcodec53 it allows also the "extra" version:
Depends: ... libavformat53, libavcodec53 | libavcodec-extra-53, libswscale2 ...

Could this simply be changed, or is there any reason not to allow the "extra" versions?
content.html:
I can't install gazebo, because it explicitly depends on libavformat53 and libswscale2 and does not allow the "extra" versions (libavformat-extra-53 and libswscale-extra-2) which I have installed.

For libavcodec53 it allows also the "extra" version: Depends: ... libavformat53, libavcodec53 | libavcodec-extra-53, libswscale2 ...

Could this simply be changed, or is there any reason not to allow the "extra" versions?

values.title: Gazebo debug debs are broken

content.raw:
Since gazebo 1.6.1, the gazebo debug debs have been less than 2 kB in size, indicating that they do not contain debug symbols.

~~~
gazebo-dbg_1.6.0-1~precise_amd64.deb	06-Apr-2013 01:42	 80M	 
gazebo-dbg_1.6.1-1~precise_amd64.deb	06-Apr-2013 07:31	1.7K	
~~~
content.html:
Since gazebo 1.6.1, the gazebo debug debs have been less than 2 kB in size, indicating that they do not contain debug symbols.

gazebo-dbg_1.6.0-1~precise_amd64.deb    06-Apr-2013 01:42    80M     
gazebo-dbg_1.6.1-1~precise_amd64.deb    06-Apr-2013 07:31   1.7K

values.title: Do not assume that binary to generate is for the building machine

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo makes the assumption that the build binary will be used on the current machine only, this is false when building packages. Flags hindering portability such as -msse should /not/ be enabled by default. The good policy is to let the user (or debian/rules) choose the compilation flags by overriding CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS, CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS and so on.

In particular, it is necessary when building Debian packages to use the flags specified by dpkg-buildflags.

A possible solution would be to provide a simple shell script at the package root level to ease the setup for people who wants to compile from source for instance.
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo makes the assumption that the build binary will be used on the current machine only, this is false when building packages. Flags hindering portability such as -msse should /not/ be enabled by default. The good policy is to let the user (or debian/rules) choose the compilation flags by overriding CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS, CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS and so on.

In particular, it is necessary when building Debian packages to use the flags specified by dpkg-buildflags.

A possible solution would be to provide a simple shell script at the package root level to ease the setup for people who wants to compile from source for instance.

values.title: Use GNUInstallDirs to provide file deployment destinations

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo makes the assumption that all distributions follow the FHS (Filesystem Hiearchy
Standard). Unfortunately this is not the case. Therefore, a solution could be to use the GNUInstallDirs.cmake module to allow deployment customization.

For instance, how this was done for [console_bridge](https://github.com/thomas-moulard/console_bridge/commit/3830f26069d7daac82599530e8d0d6c745b82d13)
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo makes the assumption that all distributions follow the FHS (Filesystem Hiearchy Standard). Unfortunately this is not the case. Therefore, a solution could be to use the GNUInstallDirs.cmake module to allow deployment customization.

For instance, how this was done for console_bridge

values.title: Man pages are missing

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo lacks of man pages for all the executables. There is a [macro](https://github.com/jrl-umi3218/jrl-cmakemodules/blob/master/man.cmake) allowing a man page to be installed (/compressed/ man pages must be installed, not the raw ones).
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo lacks of man pages for all the executables. There is a macro allowing a man page to be installed (/compressed/ man pages must be installed, not the raw ones).

values.title: Support for g++ visibility in gazebo

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

In order to keep the ABI minimal and stable, visibility could be implemented for gazebo shared libraries: http://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility

While this is not a Debian guideline, it can help to avoid breaking ABI between releases.
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

In order to keep the ABI minimal and stable, visibility could be implemented for gazebo shared libraries: http://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility

While this is not a Debian guideline, it can help to avoid breaking ABI between releases.

values.title: Do not install scripts with extension in bin

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Scripts files which are to be used by an end-users should not have an extension. This is not allowed and reveal uselessly the script language used to implement it (shell script for gzmodel_create.sh).
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Scripts files which are to be used by an end-users should not have an extension. This is not allowed and reveal uselessly the script language used to implement it (shell script for gzmodel_create.sh).

values.title: Auto source setup.sh at starting time and respect defined variables

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

It would be great not make the assumption that setup.sh will be sourced. There is no clean way to ensure this and what is inside bin/ should be usable without any additional configuration.

Two patches affecting setup.sh:

* In setup.sh only define the environment variables if they are not only defined. 
[patch example for gazebo](http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/gazebo.git;a=blob;f=debian/patches/0002-In-cmake-setup.sh-do-not-override-already-defined-en.patch;h=70e4c073c6e0cfcbe3edb0238f0b2fd13d2d4f6b;hb=HEAD)

* Replace the gazebo binary by a wrapper sourcing setup.sh then launching gazebo.

In this case, either the user does not have any specified environment variable and it will fill them with the default ones or it has some and in this case it won't change the configuration.
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

It would be great not make the assumption that setup.sh will be sourced. There is no clean way to ensure this and what is inside bin/ should be usable without any additional configuration.

Two patches affecting setup.sh:

  • In setup.sh only define the environment variables if they are not only defined. patch example for gazebo

  • Replace the gazebo binary by a wrapper sourcing setup.sh then launching gazebo.

In this case, either the user does not have any specified environment variable and it will fill them with the default ones or it has some and in this case it won't change the configuration.

values.title: Make copyright file machine readable

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo copyright file should follow the standard described by Debian Enhancement Proposal number 5 about machine readable copyright files.
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

Gazebo copyright file should follow the standard described by Debian Enhancement Proposal number 5 about machine readable copyright files.

values.title: Fixes for control files

content.raw:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

* Some fields are duplicated whereas it is not necessary (Homepage:)
* Missing the VCS-* fields which shows where is developed the package
* Short description should be "PROJECT - PKG DESCRIPTION" 
* Long description is probably not long enough to avoid a lintian warning.
* Build dependency miss doxygen and doxygen-latex but project provides a Doxyfile file.
* Rely on the package ttf-dejavu-core as these fonts are already package
content.html:
This issue and proposed solution was recommended by @thomas_moulard via mail:

  • Some fields are duplicated whereas it is not necessary (Homepage:)
  • Missing the VCS-* fields which shows where is developed the package
  • Short description should be "PROJECT - PKG DESCRIPTION"
  • Long description is probably not long enough to avoid a lintian warning.
  • Build dependency miss doxygen and doxygen-latex but project provides a Doxyfile file.
  • Rely on the package ttf-dejavu-core as these fonts are already package

values.title: Remove exit calls from code used by gazebo

content.raw:
Issue was reported by @thomas_moulard 

Some of the code inside the directory deps/ in gazebo is calling to the exit function. This should be changed to report an error code and allow proper handling in higher applications levels.

Main candidate to be fixed is deps/libccd, written in C, which uses exit call in the macro CCD_ALLOC implemented in deps/libccd/src/alloc.c.
content.html:
Issue was reported by @thomas_moulard

Some of the code inside the directory deps/ in gazebo is calling to the exit function. This should be changed to report an error code and allow proper handling in higher applications levels.

Main candidate to be fixed is deps/libccd, written in C, which uses exit call in the macro CCD_ALLOC implemented in deps/libccd/src/alloc.c.

values.title: Resolve exposed -dev interfaces on underlying libraries

content.raw:
There are at least two cases where Gazebo's public headers `#include` headers from underyling libraries:

* [cegui](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/f39abc5796cee1630ac1b6708b0dad23828a0f7e/gazebo/rendering/cegui.h?at=default#cl-26); need `libcegui-mk2-dev`
* [tbb](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/f39abc5796cee1630ac1b6708b0dad23828a0f7e/gazebo/transport/Connection.hh?at=default#cl-20); need `libtbb-dev`

This is a problem because the Gazebo deb is being built with dependencies only on the run-time version of those libraries.  So when people try to build against Gazebo, they get [errors about missing headers](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/issues/76).

In general, it would be better to keep the dependencies as is and restructure Gazebo's headers to hide the use of the underlying libraries from users.  But the quicker solution is to add the `-dev` packages to Gazebo's runtime dependencies when building a deb.
content.html:
There are at least two cases where Gazebo's public headers #include headers from underyling libraries:

  • cegui; need libcegui-mk2-dev
  • tbb; need libtbb-dev

This is a problem because the Gazebo deb is being built with dependencies only on the run-time version of those libraries. So when people try to build against Gazebo, they get errors about missing headers.

In general, it would be better to keep the dependencies as is and restructure Gazebo's headers to hide the use of the underlying libraries from users. But the quicker solution is to add the -dev packages to Gazebo's runtime dependencies when building a deb.

values.title: Merge dependency changes from prerelease to default/nightly

content.raw: We've made some fixes (e.g., for #40) on the prerelease branch.  Those changes need to be brought forward to the default (and nightly?) branch.  This ticket is a reminder to do that before release the final 1.9.0.
content.html: We've made some fixes (e.g., for #40) on the prerelease branch. Those changes need to be brought forward to the default (and nightly?) branch. This ticket is a reminder to do that before release the final 1.9.0.

values.title: Split gazebo into multiple packages

content.raw:
The suggestion was done by @thomas_moulard. Start to be needed to solve some other issue, see [comment](#!/osrf/gazebo-release/pull-request/10/control-file-improvements/activity#comment-382498) on pull request about dependencies.

Previous work by Thomas is ready at [debian.org](http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/gazebo.git;a=blob;f=debian/control;h=b4822097ca176360b91fb062c9e5b75bd12ffc96;hb=HEAD) which can be reused.
content.html:
The suggestion was done by @thomas_moulard. Start to be needed to solve some other issue, see comment on pull request about dependencies.

Previous work by Thomas is ready at debian.org which can be reused.

values.title: bullet dependency on quantal and raring collides with upstream ubuntu

content.raw:
packages.osrfoundation.org has custom versions of bullet in quantal and raring which collide with the ubuntu versions.  

We should use the upstream packages on quantal and raring: http://packages.ubuntu.com/quantal/libbullet-dev

This was working in 1.9.3 but broke in 1.9.4
content.html:
packages.osrfoundation.org has custom versions of bullet in quantal and raring which collide with the ubuntu versions.

We should use the upstream packages on quantal and raring: http://packages.ubuntu.com/quantal/libbullet-dev

This was working in 1.9.3 but broke in 1.9.4

values.title: Let shlibs handle dependencies for binary packages in debian/control

content.raw:
Currently, the "Depends:" fields of binary packages lists dependencies explicitly, this should be replaced by "${shlibs:Depends}" (see [1]).

It drastically reduce the content of the control file and avoid possible mistakes.


[1] http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/gazebo.git;a=blob;f=debian/control;h=b4822097ca176360b91fb062c9e5b75bd12ffc96;hb=HEAD
content.html:
Currently, the "Depends:" fields of binary packages lists dependencies explicitly, this should be replaced by "${shlibs:Depends}" (see [1]).

It drastically reduce the content of the control file and avoid possible mistakes.

[1] http://anonscm.debian.org/gitweb/?p=debian-science/packages/gazebo.git;a=blob;f=debian/control;h=b4822097ca176360b91fb062c9e5b75bd12ffc96;hb=HEAD

values.title: Homepage field is duplicated

content.raw:
Currently, the Homepage field is repeated several times.

The fields in the source package are automatically inherited so this is not necessary.
It will also produce a lintian notice (http://lintian.debian.org/tags/binary-control-field-duplicates-source.html)
content.html:
Currently, the Homepage field is repeated several times.

The fields in the source package are automatically inherited so this is not necessary. It will also produce a lintian notice (http://lintian.debian.org/tags/binary-control-field-duplicates-source.html)

values.title: The original upstream tarball should not be altered directly.

content.raw:
The original tarball should _never_ be modified directly during the package process.

The "\*/cmake/" directories should be replaced by equivalent patches located in "\*/debian/patches" directory. git-pq (git patch queue) is a very practical tool to manage these files.
See http://honk.sigxcpu.org/projects/git-buildpackage/manual-html/man.gbp.pq.html

The patches should follow DEP-3 tagging syntax: http://dep.debian.net/deps/dep3/
content.html:
The original tarball should never be modified directly during the package process.

The "*/cmake/" directories should be replaced by equivalent patches located in "*/debian/patches" directory. git-pq (git patch queue) is a very practical tool to manage these files. See http://honk.sigxcpu.org/projects/git-buildpackage/manual-html/man.gbp.pq.html

The patches should follow DEP-3 tagging syntax: http://dep.debian.net/deps/dep3/

values.title: Use changelog from bitbucket

content.raw:
Changelog in gazebo is now host [in the code repository](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/3de47fea808f71a623d9a4dca2f89efd16ffb0f3/Changelog.md?at=default) and would be great to have the same information into the debian changelogs.

Submitted by @_jrivero_ .
content.html:
Changelog in gazebo is now host in the code repository and would be great to have the same information into the debian changelogs.

Submitted by @jrivero .

values.title: gazebo-current package sources missing

content.raw:
The current packages on the ppa are built as gazebo-current, and the ros packages built from bloom (2.4.0) build-depend on gazebo-current, but I can't find where the ppa packages debian/ directories come from.

(Note: I've been tracking gazebo-release for a while now to rebuild gazebo against boost 1.54, which is the most current boost in Debian unstable)
content.html:
The current packages on the ppa are built as gazebo-current, and the ros packages built from bloom (2.4.0) build-depend on gazebo-current, but I can't find where the ppa packages debian/ directories come from.

(Note: I've been tracking gazebo-release for a while now to rebuild gazebo against boost 1.54, which is the most current boost in Debian unstable)

values.title: Change libcurl4-openssl-dev to libcurl4-gnutls-dev

content.raw:
[Gazebo pull request #812](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/812/dem-support) needs libgdal. libgdal depends on libcurl4-gnutls-dev, that conflicts with libcurl4-openssl-dev, currently used by Gazebo.

I propose to jump to libcurl4-gnutls-dev .
content.html:
Gazebo pull request #812 needs libgdal. libgdal depends on libcurl4-gnutls-dev, that conflicts with libcurl4-openssl-dev, currently used by Gazebo.

I propose to jump to libcurl4-gnutls-dev .

values.title: Release gazebo 2.1.0 as gazebo on saucy

content.raw: @tfoote mentioned that we should use the latest version of gazebo on saucy. We can consider making a gazebo 3.0 release as gazebo-current.
content.html: @tfoote mentioned that we should use the latest version of gazebo on saucy. We can consider making a gazebo 3.0 release as gazebo-current.

values.title: Convert gazebo on Trusty to use ogre 1.9

content.raw: It looks like Ubuntu Trusty is going to ship with OGRE 1.9 and 1.8 available. I think we should plan to package against 1.9. This is to track that for release. It will probably require an upstream patch due to a moved header. See discussion here: https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/pull/2805
content.html: It looks like Ubuntu Trusty is going to ship with OGRE 1.9 and 1.8 available. I think we should plan to package against 1.9. This is to track that for release. It will probably require an upstream patch due to a moved header. See discussion here: https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/pull/2805
